usefulItems: ceramic or glass bowl, fine mesh sieve, bowl, plastic wrap, serving bowl
title: Carrot and fennel slaw with sprouted buckwheat

ingredients.content: 300 g fennel bulb, trimmed and cut into quarters
200 g carrots, cut into pieces (4 cm)
1 celery stalk, cut into pieces (4 cm)
1 green apple, cored and cut into quarters
2 spring onions/shallots, cut into pieces (4 cm)
2 - 5 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only

preparations.content: Insert simmering basket and weigh buckwheat into it. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and rinse buckwheat thoroughly under cold running water. Transfer buckwheat into a ceramic or glass bowl. Cover with cold water and leave to soak for 2 hours.
Drain buckwheat using a large fine-mesh sieve, then rinse well under running water to remove all excess starch.

Place sieve over a bowl. Spread buckwheat around sides of sieve, cover with plastic wrap and leave at room temperature in a sunny area until sprouted (1-2 days), rinsing buckwheat 2-3 times a day (see Tips).
Place all remaining ingredients, except almonds, into mixing bowl and mix <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>.
Transfer into a serving bowl, add almonds and sprouted buckwheat, stir to combine and serve.

hintsAndTricks: Place buckwheat in an area where it can receive plenty of daylight, since this will help it sprout.
Once buckwheat has sprouted, do not rinse again. You can store buckwheat in refrigerator for up to 24 hours after sprouting. Ensure buckwheat are dry before storing in refrigerator.
Sprouted buckwheat helps make them easier to digest and to improve the absorbability of many of buckwheat’s nutrients.
Buckwheat sprouts can vary from 5 mm-2.5 cm in length.
